before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"18h6c","text":"Note that this protocol needs 2 values to do a selection for each source plate","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"5igve","text":"This protocol is meant to select the samples from one or more source plate(s) that has 2 different selecting conditions: one condition gives higher values and the other lower values. From these selected samples this protocol create final plates with the samples alone or mixed with different reactive(s).\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"egapf","text":"The instructions for running this protocol are a python script for an Opentrons 2 robot and a excel file with several variables making the protocol modular to reactives, volumes of transfer, type of plates, etc.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"364sg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2hdb","text":"In our lab we are selecting samples by their after night OD in 2 different antibiotics and create PCR plates (with water) and 2 stock plates (with glycerol), but it can be used with other selection characteristics such as expression of GFP and with other types of reactives.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d50r7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6c6pa","text":"This protocol description corresponds to the entry LAP-ColonyCounterSelection-OT2-1.0.0 of the LAP repository","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":51,"length":36}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":95,"length":14}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"2FDC3F10DC24414E9952E7BF60DA44E3","url":"http://www.laprepo.com"}}}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"6198m","text":"This protocol was developed with python 3.7.1, OT App Software Version 6.3.1 and API level version 2.14 in a Linux 4.14.74 system (these are the OT-2 specifications). In the script several packages are used:  pandas (0.25.3), openpyxl (3.1.2), math, random and numpy (1.15.1)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7nahp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dgp8i","text":"It has been tested with cultures from Pseudomonas putida KT2440 as part of a counter-selection step in the High-throughput workflow for the genotypic characterization of transposon library variants.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":38,"length":26}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"es36t","text":"30% glycerol and water have been successfully dispensed using this protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"94ur2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"38qd9","text":"The maximum number of 96-well plates per run given 1 source plates, 1 pipette and replacement of the tiprack set as True is 8 final plates (using 1 tip rack and 1 tube rack for falcons tubes).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
